716901f-b.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Beaver Street
716901f-b.text:
(1)
54 to 2 Broad Street, west side, from north of Beaver Street to
and including Wall Street. 1-11 Nassau Street, west side, from Wall
to Pine Streets, is shown in the background.
July 26, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same.
September 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

716908f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Marketfield Street
716908f-a.text:
(1)
76-108 Broad Street, from south of Marketfield Street to Water
Street. On the right, with the flagpole, is the Maritime Exchange.
The small building in the centre houses the Bush Terminal Company,
and behind it looms the 17-story New York Telephone Company Building.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, six years later.
April 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
76-122 Broad Street, west side, from south of Marketfield Street
to Front Street.
April 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

716627f-a.text:
Beaver Street, south side, west from, but not including Broad, to and

duce Exchange Buildin2.

716626f-a.title: Manhattan: Beaver Street - Broad Street
716626f-a.text:
27 Beaver Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Broad Street.
The building was awarded second prize by the Downtown League for
the best alteration in the year.
1924.
Albert Rothschild.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

716902f-c.text:

62-30 Broad Street, west side, from north of Beaver Street to

april 27, 1930.

716905f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Beaver Street
716905f-a.text:
6876 Sroad Street, west side, from Beaver to south of
Marketfield Streets, seen across the ercavation for the Inter-
national Telephone and Telegraph Building, also showing 30-20
Beaver Street, south side, from Broad Street to east of New
Street. The building in right centre is the American Bank
Note Company.
August 29, 1927.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODU1TIONS.

716907f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Beaver Street
716907f-a.text:
70-30 Broad Street, west side, from and includng Beaver
Street to,but not quite including Exchange Place. The American
Banknote Company Building is seen in the left foreground. The
Johnston Building, in the right background, wdll be torn down in
1931 and the 48-story Continental Bank Trust Company Building
ereoted on its site.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
